definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)

sentences.english: Our head teacher has shared the cake among all the students at the party.
sentences.chinese: 我们的班主任老师在晚会上把蛋糕分给每个学生。

sentences.english: He weighed out half pound of coffee beans to them.
sentences.chinese: 他称出半斤咖啡豆分给他们。

sentences.english: Distribute it to others form dawn to duck, starting form the person closest to you.
sentences.chinese: 从早到晚地分给别人，从你身边最近的人分起。

sentences.english: He divided the cake among the children.
sentences.chinese: 他把这个饼子分给孩子们。

sentences.english: The cook served out tins of food to all the mountaineers.
sentences.chinese: 炊事员把罐头食品分给所有登山队员。

sentences.english: This is my advice. Give a glittering scale to each of the other fish.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你把你的闪光鳞，分给每条鱼一片。

sentences.english: He agreed to divide the prize between Tom and Ann.
sentences.chinese: 他同意把这笔奖金分给汤姆和安两个人。

sentences.english: You can hive off some of the work to us if necessary.
sentences.chinese: 如果必要的话，你可以把部分工作分给我们做。

sentences.english: She portioned out the money equally between both children.
sentences.chinese: 她把钱均分给两个孩子。

sentences.english: In Joppa, Dorcas distributed garments to the poor.
sentences.chinese: 在约帕，多加把衣服分给贫穷的人。

sentences.english: The general cantoned out the country to his men.
sentences.chinese: 将军把那个国家划分成小分给他的部下。

sentences.english: 4，Enquiries are so large that we can only than allot you 200 cases.
sentences.chinese: 询盘如此之多，我们只能分给你们200箱货。

sentences.english: Xuan gave his ex-wife half of their property, and she got custody of their child.
sentences.chinese: 宣分给他的前妻一半财产，还把孩子的监护权给了她。

sentences.english: Mrs. Simpson gave him the first dish.
sentences.chinese: 辛普森太太第一个将汤分给了他。

sentences.english: Selling their possessions and goods, they gave to anyone as he had need.
sentences.chinese: 并且卖了田产家业，照各人所需用的分给各人。

sentences.english: The new rulers took farms from the landlords and gave them to the tenants.
sentences.chinese: 新的政府从地主手中取得了田土，并把它们分给佃户。

definition: to transfer (income, profits etc) to higher authorities
to pass on to/to transfer to/to hand on to/to pass to (in football etc)
to distribute/to assign/to allocate/to partition (a hard drive)
to hand over to/to give to higher authority/to seek connections in high places
to send/to give as a present
